verses.verse: Him that is weak <WG770> in the faith <WG4102> receive ye <WG4355>, but <WG1161> not <WG3361> to <WG1519> doubtful <WG1261> disputations <WG1253>. not: or, not to judge his doubtful thoughts
For <WG3303> one <WG3739> believeth <WG4100> that he may eat <WG5315> all things <WG3956>: another <WG1161>, who is weak <WG770>, eateth <WG2068> herbs <WG3001>.

Let <WG1848> not <WG3361> him that eateth <WG2068> despise <WG1848> him that eateth <WG2068> not <WG3361>; and <WG2532> let <WG2068> not <WG3361> him which eateth <WG2068> not <WG3361> judge <WG2919> him that eateth <WG2068>: for <WG1063> God <WG2316> hath received <WG4355> him <WG846>.

Who <WG5101> art <WG1488> thou <WG4771> that judgest <WG2919> another man's <WG245> servant <WG3610>? to his own <WG2398> master <WG2962> he standeth <WG4739> or <WG2228> falleth <WG4098>. Yea <WG1161>, he shall be holden up <WG2476>: for <WG1063> God <WG2316> is <WG2076> able <WG1415> to make <WG2476> him <WG846> stand <WG2476>.

One <WG3303> man <WG3739> esteemeth <WG2919> one day <WG2250> above <WG3844> another <WG2250>: <WG1161> another <WG3739> esteemeth <WG2919> every <WG3956> day <WG2250> alike. Let <WG4135> every man <WG1538> be fully persuaded <WG4135> in <WG1722> his own <WG2398> mind <WG3563>. fully persuaded: or, fully assured

He that regardeth <WG5426> the day <WG2250>, regardeth <WG5426> it unto the Lord <WG2962>; and <WG2532> he that regardeth <WG5426> not <WG3361> the day <WG2250>, to the Lord <WG2962> he doth <WG5426> not <WG3756> regard <WG5426> it. He that eateth <WG2068>, eateth <WG2068> to the Lord <WG2962>, for <WG1063> he giveth God <WG2316> thanks <WG2168>; and <WG2532> he that eateth <WG2068> not <WG3361>, to the Lord <WG2962> he eateth <WG2068> not <WG3756>, and <WG2532> giveth God <WG2316> thanks <WG2168>. regardeth: or, observeth
For <WG1063> none <WG3762> of us <WG2257> liveth <WG2198> to himself <WG1438>, and <WG2532> no man <WG3762> dieth <WG599> to himself <WG1438>.

For <WG1063> whether <WG1437> <WG5037> we live <WG2198>, we live <WG2198> unto the Lord <WG2962>; and whether <WG1437> <WG5037> we die <WG599>, we die <WG599> unto the Lord <WG2962>: whether <WG1437> <WG5037> we live <WG2198> therefore <WG3767>, or <WG1437> <WG5037> die <WG599>, we are <WG2070> the Lord's <WG2962>.

For <WG1063> to <WG1519> this <WG5124> end Christ <WG5547> both <WG2532> died <WG599>, and <WG2532> rose <WG450>, and <WG2532> revived <WG326>, that <WG2443> he might be Lord <WG2961> both <WG2532> of the dead <WG3498> and <WG2532> living <WG2198>.

But <WG1161> why <WG5101> dost <WG2919> thou <WG4771> judge <WG2919> thy <WG4675> brother <WG80>? or <WG2228> <WG2532> why <WG5101> dost <WG1848> thou <WG4771> set at nought <WG1848> thy <WG4675> brother <WG80>? for <WG1063> we shall <WG3936> all <WG3956> stand before <WG3936> the judgment seat <WG968> of Christ <WG5547>.

For <WG1063> it is written <WG1125>, As I <WG1473> live <WG2198>, saith <WG3004> the Lord <WG2962>, <WG3754> every <WG3956> knee <WG1119> shall bow <WG2578> to me <WG1698>, and <WG2532> every <WG3956> tongue <WG1100> shall confess <WG1843> to God <WG2316>.
So <WG3767> then <WG686> every one <WG1538> of us <WG2257> shall give <WG1325> account <WG3056> of <WG4012> himself <WG1438> to God <WG2316>.

Let us <WG2919> not therefore <WG3767> judge <WG2919> one another <WG240> any more <WG3371>: but <WG235> judge <WG2919> this <WG5124> rather <WG3123>, that no man <WG3361> put <WG5087> a stumblingblock <WG4348> or <WG2228> an occasion to fall <WG4625> in his brother's way <WG80>.

I know <WG1492>, and <WG2532> am persuaded <WG3982> by <WG1722> the Lord <WG2962> Jesus <WG2424>, that <WG3754> there is nothing <WG3762> unclean <WG2839> of <WG1223> itself <WG1438>: but <WG1508> to him that esteemeth <WG3049> any thing <WG5100> to be <WG1511> unclean <WG2839>, to him <WG1565> it is unclean <WG2839>. unclean: Gr. common

But <WG1161> if <WG1487> thy <WG4675> brother <WG80> be grieved <WG3076> with <WG1223> thy meat <WG1033>, now <WG3765> walkest thou <WG4043> not <WG3765> charitably <WG26> <WG2596>. Destroy <WG622> not <WG3361> him <WG1565> with thy <WG4675> meat <WG1033>, for <WG5228> whom <WG3739> Christ <WG5547> died <WG599>. charitably: Gr. according to charity
Let <WG987> not <WG3361> then <WG3767> your <WG5216> good <WG18> be evil spoken of <WG987>:

For <WG1063> the kingdom <WG932> of God <WG2316> is <WG2076> not <WG3756> meat <WG1035> and <WG2532> drink <WG4213>; but <WG235> righteousness <WG1343>, and <WG2532> peace <WG1515>, and <WG2532> joy <WG5479> in <WG1722> the Holy <WG40> Ghost <WG4151>.
For <WG1063> he that in <WG1722> these things <WG5125> serveth <WG1398> Christ <WG5547> is acceptable <WG2101> to God <WG2316>, and <WG2532> approved <WG1384> of men <WG444>.

Let us <WG1377> therefore <WG686> <WG3767> follow after <WG1377> the things which make for <WG3588> peace <WG1515>, and <WG2532> things wherewith <WG1519> one <WG240> may edify <WG3619> another <WG240>.

For <WG1752> meat <WG1033> destroy <WG2647> not <WG3361> the work <WG2041> of God <WG2316>. All things <WG3956> indeed <WG3303> are pure <WG2513>; but <WG235> it is evil <WG2556> for that man <WG444> who eateth <WG2068> with <WG1223> offence <WG4348>.

It is good <WG2570> neither <WG3361> to eat <WG5315> flesh <WG2907>, nor <WG3366> to drink <WG4095> wine <WG3631>, nor <WG3366> any thing whereby <WG1722> <WG3739> thy <WG4675> brother <WG80> stumbleth <WG4350>, or <WG2228> is offended <WG4624>, or <WG2228> is made weak <WG770>.

Hast <WG2192> thou <WG4771> faith <WG4102>? have <WG2192> it to <WG2596> thyself <WG4572> before <WG1799> God <WG2316>. Happy <WG3107> is he that condemneth <WG2919> not <WG3361> himself <WG1438> in <WG1722> that thing which <WG3739> he alloweth <WG1381>.

And <WG1161> he that doubteth <WG1252> is damned <WG2632> if <WG1437> he eat <WG5315>, because <WG3754> he eateth not <WG3756> of <WG1537> faith <WG4102>: for <WG1161> whatsoever <WG3739> <WG3956> is not <WG3756> of <WG1537> faith <WG4102> is <WG2076> sin <WG266>. doubteth: or, discerneth and putteth a difference between meats damned: or, condemned, or liable to punishment
